wackpackr.io

Class BinaryIO

  • java.lang.Object
    • wackpackr.io.BinaryIO
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public class BinaryIO
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable
    Combined wrapper for I/O streams, that allows reading and writing an arbitrary number of bits at once, irrespective of the byte boundaries of the underlying streams.

    Possible to use with or without an input stream.

    Author:
    Juho Juurinen

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BinaryIO()
      Constructs a new BinaryIO instance for writing purposes only, without an input stream.
      BinaryIO(byte[] bytes)
      Constructs a new BinaryIO instance for both reading and writing purposes, with the given byte array as the input stream.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close() 
      byte[] getBytesOut()
      Returns current contents of the underlying output stream.
      long read32Bits()
      Reads and returns the next 32-bit chunk in the input stream, cast as a long value.
      boolean readBit()
      Reads and returns the next bit in the input stream.
      int readBits(int bits)
      Reads and returns the requested number of bits next in the input stream, cast as an integer.
      byte readByte()
      Reads and returns the next byte in the input stream, irrespective of where the read pointer is within current byte buffer.
      Byte readByteOrNull()
      Reads and returns the next byte in the input stream, or null if the input stream has already been read through to the end.
      byte[] readBytes(int count)
      Reads and returns the requested number of bytes next in the input stream.
      BinaryIO write32Bits(long l)
      Writes a 32-bit chunk to the end of the output stream.
      BinaryIO writeBit(boolean b)
      Writes one bit to the end of the output stream.
      BinaryIO writeBits(int i, int bits)
      Writes the given value to the end of the output stream using the specified number of bits.
      BinaryIO writeByte(byte b)
      Writes one byte to the end of the output stream, irrespective of where the write pointer is within the current byte buffer.
      BinaryIO writeBytes(byte[] bs)
      Writes an arbitrary number of bytes to the end of the output stream.

    • Method Detail

      • readBit

        public boolean readBit()
                throws IOException
        Reads and returns the next bit in the input stream.
        Returns:
        the next bit in the input stream as boolean
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if no input stream has been set
        IOException - if there's an error reading the input stream
        EOFException - if the input stream has been read through to the end

      • readByte

        public byte readByte()
              throws IOException
        Reads and returns the next byte in the input stream, irrespective of where the read pointer is within current byte buffer.
        Returns:
        the next byte in the input stream
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if no input stream has been set
        IOException - if there's an error reading the input stream
        EOFException - if the input stream has been read through to the end

      • readByteOrNull

        public Byte readByteOrNull()
                    throws IOException
        Reads and returns the next byte in the input stream, or null if the input stream has already been read through to the end.
        Returns:
        the next byte in input stream, or null if the input stream has reached the end
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if no input stream has been set
        IOException - if there's an error reading the input stream

      • readBits

        public int readBits(int bits)
             throws IOException
        Reads and returns the requested number of bits next in the input stream, cast as an integer.
        Parameters:
        bits - number of bits to read
        Returns:
        requested bits as an integer
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if no input stream has been set
        IOException - if there's an error reading the input stream
        EOFException - if the input stream is read through to the end during operation

      • readBytes

        public byte[] readBytes(int count)
                 throws IOException
        Reads and returns the requested number of bytes next in the input stream.
        Parameters:
        count - number of bytes to read
        Returns:
        requested number of bytes as array
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if no input stream has been set
        IOException - if there's an error reading the input stream
        EOFException - if the input stream is read through to the end during operation

      • read32Bits

        public long read32Bits()
                throws IOException
        Reads and returns the next 32-bit chunk in the input stream, cast as a long value.
        Returns:
        the next 32 bits in the input stream as long
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if no input stream has been set
        IOException - if there's an error reading the input stream
        EOFException - if there is less than 32 bits left in the input stream

      • writeBit

        public BinaryIO writeBit(boolean b)
                  throws IOException
        Writes one bit to the end of the output stream.
        Parameters:
        b - bit to write as boolean
        Returns:
        a reference to this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if there's an error writing to the output stream

      • writeByte

        public BinaryIO writeByte(byte b)
                   throws IOException
        Writes one byte to the end of the output stream, irrespective of where the write pointer is within the current byte buffer.
        Parameters:
        b - byte to write
        Returns:
        a reference to this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if there's an error writing to the output stream

      • writeBits

        public BinaryIO writeBits(int i,
                          int bits)
                   throws IOException
        Writes the given value to the end of the output stream using the specified number of bits. Note that this method does not check whether the value fits into the given bit size — trying to write values with less bits than possible in practice corrupts the output stream.
        Parameters:
        i - value to write
        bits - number of bits to allocate for the value
        Returns:
        a reference to this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if there's an error writing to the output stream

      • writeBytes

        public BinaryIO writeBytes(byte[] bs)
                    throws IOException
        Writes an arbitrary number of bytes to the end of the output stream.
        Parameters:
        bs - bytes to write
        Returns:
        a reference to this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if there's an error writing to the output stream

      • write32Bits

        public BinaryIO write32Bits(long l)
                     throws IOException
        Writes a 32-bit chunk to the end of the output stream.
        Parameters:
        l - 32 bits of data to write as long
        Returns:
        a reference to this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if there's an error writing to the output stream
